metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29900 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mis-trained branch predictions for return instructions may allow arbitraryspeculative code execution under certain microarchitecture-dependentconditions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1135-kvm - 4.15.0-1135.140
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-aws - 4.15.0-1150.163
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1161-azure - 4.15.0-1161.176
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1060-dell300x - 4.15.0-1060.65
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1145-gcp - 4.15.0-1145.161
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-oracle - 4.15.0-1114.125
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1127-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1127.135
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1145-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1145.155
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-204.215').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1135.140').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.163').
